programme.title: UFC Fight Night
programme.desc: Cory Sandhagen (17-5-0) faces Deiveson Figueiredo (24-4-1) in the bantamweight main event; Reinier de Ridder (19-2) vs. Bo Nickal (7-0) in a middleweight co-main event; Santiago Ponzinibbio (31-8) vs. Daniel Rodriguez (18-5) in a welterweight bout.

programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the WNBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (4-1) rebounded from its loss to San Antonio with a 37-33 win over Arlington behind 345 total yards and four touchdowns from Jordan Ta'amu; Michigan (3-2) had its two-win streak snapped by St. Louis, 32-27, despite Bryce Perkins.

programme.title: WNBA Preseason Basketball
programme.desc: Indiana went 20-20 last season, securing its first playoff berth since 2016 before getting swept by Connecticut, but used the offseason to upgrade its roster by adding DeWanna Bonner from Connecticut and Natasha Howard from Dallas.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Colorado avoided elimination with a 7-4 win over Dallas in Game 6 behind two goals from Valeri Nichuskin; Roope Hintz led the Stars with two goals and two assists, along with a goal and three assists from Mikko Rantanen, in the loss.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Los Angeles swept a three-game series with the Braves at Dodger Stadium earlier this season, outscoring Atlanta in the three games, 15-7; Atlanta split a four-game series with the Dodgers at Truist Park last year.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: 2025 NHL Draft Lottery
programme.desc: The 16 teams that missed the playoffs learn their spot in the 2025 NHL Draft; San Jose holds the highest percentage for the top pick at 25.5% followed by Chicago at 13.5% and Nashville at 11.5% for a shot at top prospects like Matthew Schaefer.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing
programme.desc: Naoya Inoue (29-0-0, 26 KOs) defends his undisputed super bantamweight title for the fourth time since beating Marion Tapales for the IBF belt on Dec. 26, 2023; Ramon Cardenas (26-1-0, 14 KOs) won his last 14 bouts since losing to Danny Flores.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Florida won three of its four regular-season meetings with Toronto after a 3-1 win in the last matchup on April 8 behind goals from three different players and 17 saves from Sergei Bobrovsky; John Tavares scored the lone goal for the Maple Leafs.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.desc: Cameras follow the newest members of the NFL as they go through the draft, preseason, training camp, numerous hazing rituals instigated by veteran players, and an assortment of other situations that will test each rookie's mettle.

programme.title: SEC Inside
programme.desc: SEC teams prepare for their upcoming opponent with practice sessions and work inside the film room, featuring coaches drilling their players and offering advice, an exclusive look at how the schools game plan, and exclusive talks with team members.

programme.title: American Cornhole League
programme.desc: Cornhole consists of throwing beanbags at a slanted board with a hole near the top, attempting to reach 21 points before an opponent; league consists of competitive tournaments for the professional, collegiate, and youth divisions.

programme.title: Equestrian
programme.desc: Equestrian is the only sport staged in the Olympic Games that involves animals, and it is one of the few sports where men and women compete head-to-head; equestrian includes: dressage, jumping and eventing as both rider and horse are challenged.

programme.title: Corgi Races
programme.desc: Corgis compete in races down the track of Emerald Downs in eight qualifying heats in hopes of earning a spot in the championship final race with the winner taking home the prize and the bragging rights as top dog at the annual event.

programme.title: American Cornhole League
programme.desc: Cornhole consists of throwing beanbags at a slanted board with a hole near the top, attempting to reach 21 points before an opponent; league consists of competitive tournaments for the professional, collegiate, and youth divisions.

programme.title: College Lacrosse
programme.desc: No. 2 Princeton (12-2) defeated Harvard, 11-8, in the semifinals behind Braedon Saeris; No. 1 Cornell (13-1) beat Yale, 21-14, and won its last five meetings with the Tigers after a 15-10 win on March 15 behind five goals from CJ Kirst.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: Rivalries come to be for various reasons, but a hit by Claude Lemieux of the Colorado Avalanche on Kris Draper of the Detroit Red Wings in the late 1990s would ignite a rivalry in the NHL that would stand the test of time between the two teams.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: Iowa guard Caitlin Clark, UCLA guard Kiki Rice and South Carolina center Kamilla Cardoso go through the record-breaking 2023-24 season, as Clark looks to become the all-time leading scorer in collegiate basketball history over Pete Maravich.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Isiah Thomas, Joe Dumars, Rick Mahorn, Dennis Rodman and Bill Laimbeer led the Detroit Pistons to back-to-back NBA championships in 1989 and 1990, but the team's tactics earned them a tough reputation and a memorable nickname that has endured.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: Basketball royalty has always been in the Hurley family, from the dad, Bob Sr., in high school coaching to Bobby at Duke, but now Dan Hurley has settled into his spot amongst college coaching greats after leading UConn to back-to-back titles.

programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Eccentric Raiders owner Al Davis had a maverick style to running his team, an approach that would constantly put him at odds with NFL Commissioner Pete Rozelle, showing how Davis would elevate his team into one of the best in the league.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The relationship between Bill Parcells and Bill Belichick is traced over four decades; Parcells and Belichick first worked together as assistants with the New York Giants and have forged a bond that few men of their stature have ever experienced.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: RaceDay previews the Wurth 400 and Austin Cindric, who comes off his first win of the season with a win at Talladega, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in the seventh event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Joaquin Niemann won the individual title with a three-shot victory over Lucas Herbert, while Legion XIII won the team crown in the sixth event in Mexico City on April 27.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Los Angeles swept a three-game series with the Braves at Dodger Stadium earlier this season, outscoring Atlanta in the three games, 15-7; Atlanta split a four-game series with the Dodgers at Truist Park last year.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Qualifications
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers aim for the best starting spot in the upcoming race, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Scott McLaughlin averaged 125.552 mph to win the pole last year before winning the race over Will Power.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Dennis Hauger gained an early 14-point lead in the standings over Lochie Hughes after a dominant win at St. Petersburg in the opener; Jacob Abel won the race at Barber last year over Nolan Siegel en route to finishing the season as runner-up.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Qualifications
programme.desc: NXT drivers aim for the best starting position in the upcoming race in Alabama, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded the pole position on the front row of the starting grid; the second-fastest time starts outside the pole sitter.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Practice
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race in Alabama; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Austin Cindric secured his first win of the season with a win at Talladega over Kyle Larson, while William Byron leads the standings; Chase Elliott averaged 116.492 mph en route to his win at Texas last year, beating Brad Keselowski under caution.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: San Diego is coming off of a 3-1 defeat to Real Salt Lake on April 26 with their lone goal of the match scored by Hirving Lozano from the penalty spot; Dallas claimed a 4-3 victory against Inter Miami on April 27, led by a Pedrinho goal and assist.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Austin Cindric secured his first win of the season with a win at Talladega over Kyle Larson, while William Byron leads the standings; Chase Elliott averaged 116.492 mph en route to his win at Texas last year, beating Brad Keselowski under caution.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Omaha claimed victories against Grand Rapids in their first three meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on April 17 with a 3-0 scoreline; Brooke Nuneviller and Cooper Reaggan both had 10 kills for the Supernovas in the win.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio (1-4) comes off a 27-3 loss to Houston after beating DC, 24-18, but won its meeting with the Stallions last season, 18-9; Birmingham (3-2) had its three-game win streak snapped by Memphis, 24-20, despite two TDs from Case Cookus.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Kyle Kirkwood moved into second place and cut his deficit to two-time defending champion Alex Palou to 34 points after winning at Long Beach; Scott McLaughlin won the last two races at Birmingham after averaging 106.38 mph last year.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Austin Cindric secured his first win of the season with a win at Talladega over Kyle Larson, while William Byron leads the standings; Chase Elliott averaged 116.492 mph en route to his win at Texas last year, beating Brad Keselowski under caution.

programme.desc: Kyle Kirkwood moved into second place and cut his deficit to two-time defending champion Alex Palou to 34 points after winning at Long Beach; Scott McLaughlin won the last two races at Birmingham after averaging 106.38 mph last year.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Arlington (3-2) defeated the Battlehawks, 30-15, on April 19 behind 149 passing yards and a touchdown from Luis Perez and a rushing TD from Dae Dae Hunter; St. Louis (3-2) is 2-1 at home after a 32-27 win over Michigan on April 26.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: Culture of Winning: Polynesian Football Pride
programme.desc: A look at the success of Polynesian NFL players and the impact their sports success has back on their communities; Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa will be joined by Penei Sewell, Puka Nacua, Jonah Savaiinaea and Chris Henry Jr.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Omaha claimed victories against Grand Rapids in their first three meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on April 17 with a 3-0 scoreline; Brooke Nuneviller and Cooper Reaggan both had 10 kills for the Supernovas in the win.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Nashville claimed a 2-0 victory against Atlanta United in their most recent meeting on Sept. 14 through goals from Alex Muyl and Hany Mukhtar; Sam Surridge and Teal Bunbury provided the assists for Nashville in the win away from home.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Richmond (2-5-0) comes off an 83-63 loss to Melbourne on April 24; Hawthorn (5-2-0) won both encounters against the Tigers last season, including a 131-68 victory in Round 23, as the Hawks scored seven goals in the match's first 11 minutes.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup
programme.desc: Mauritania is coming off of a 5-4 defeat to Iran on matchday 1, led by a Cheikh Belkheir hat-trick; Portugal claimed an 11-9 victory against Paraguay to open their tournament where Miguel Pintado and B Martins found the net with hat-tricks.

programme.title: FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup
programme.desc: Seychelles comes off of a 6-3 defeat to Belarus on matchday 1 with goals scored by Remy De Ketelaere, Brandon Labrosse and Terrence Amade; Guatemala lost to Japan to open their tournament, 6-2, with Berny Marroquin and Miguel Angel Gonzalez strikes.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Tyler Ankrum secured his first Truck Series win since 2019 with his victory at Rockingham over Jake Garcia; Kyle Busch averaged 118.471 mph en route to his win at Texas last year, defeating current points leader Corey Heim by 0.112 seconds.

programme.title: Women's College Lacrosse
programme.desc: Villanova (11-6) defeated UConn, 16-10, in the semifinals; No. 21 Denver (13-5) has won all 13 meetings with the Wildcats after a 17-7 win on April 26 behind five goals and two assists from Raegan Wilson, along with five points from Eva Thomsen-Marr.

programme.desc: Rookie Dennis Hauger gained an early 14-point lead in the standings over Lochie Hughes after a dominant win at St. Petersburg in the opener; Jacob Abel won the race at Barber last year over Nolan Siegel en route to finishing the season as runner-up.
